subject: Can't run Junit on Windows - How can I help ?
msgSnippet: I am a newbie. I also ran into the fact that JUNIT doesn t use the pathSeparator of Java. The details can be found at

I am a newbie. I also ran into the fact that JUNIT doesn't use the 
pathSep=
arator of Java. The details can be found at 
http://rlucente.bloki.com/foru=
m/messages-index.jsp?
tid=3D124461&fid=3D54832#forum-message1133407541851rl=
ucente.

Since I am new, the best that I can do is offer to test and write =

documentation.

rlucente@...


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Hien=
 Nguyen <aaavn123@y...> wrote:
>
> 
> Thank you for your answer.
> I alread=
y  fixed my problem, I didn't add JUnit Home

hen I did, it OK.
> 
> I wrote JUNIT can't run on Windows because I saw:
> =

> name: testjunit/Sim=
pleTest)" 
> on the error
> 
> so I afraided that the separate of directory=
 in the
> code of JUNIT don't use the pathSeparator of Java, it
> used the =
separate sign "/" of UNIX, so it can't run on
> Windows (windows used the "=
\" separator)
> 
> Regard.
>
